definitions.text: command with authority
examples: He directed the children to do their homework

definitions.text: intend (something) to move towards a certain goal
examples: He aimed his fists towards his opponent's face
criticism directed at her superior
direct your anger towards others, not towards yourself

definitions.text: guide the actors in (plays and films)
be in charge of
take somebody somewhere
examples: We lead him to our chief
can you take me to the main entrance?
He conducted us to the palace

definitions.text: cause to go somewhere
examples: The explosion sent the car flying in the air
She sent her children to camp
He directed all his energies into his dissertation

definitions.text: point or cause to go (blows, weapons, or objects such as photographic equipment) towards
examples: Please don't aim at your little brother!
He trained his gun on the burglar
Don't train your camera on the women
Take a swipe at one's opponent

definitions.text: lead, as in the performance of a composition
examples: conduct an orchestra; Barenboim conducted the Chicago symphony for years

definitions.text: give directions to; point somebody into a certain direction
examples: I directed them towards the town hall

definitions.text: specifically design a product, event, or activity for a certain public
direct the course; determine the direction of travelling
put an address on (an envelope)
plan and direct (a complex undertaking)
examples: he masterminded the robbery

definitions.text: direct in spatial dimensions; proceeding without deviation or interruption; straight and short
examples: a direct route
a direct flight
a direct hit

definitions.text: having no intervening persons, agents, conditions
examples: in direct sunlight
in direct contact with the voters
direct exposure to the disease
a direct link
the direct cause of the accident
direct vote

definitions.text: straightforward in means or manner or behavior or language or action
examples: a direct question
a direct response
a direct approach

definitions.text: in a straight unbroken line of descent from parent to child
examples: lineal ancestors
lineal heirs
a direct descendant of the king
direct heredity

definitions.text: moving from west to east on the celestial sphere; or--for planets--around the sun in the same direction as the Earth
similar in nature or effect or relation to another quantity
examples: a term is in direct proportion to another term if it increases (or decreases) as the other increases (or decreases)

definitions.text: (of a current) flowing in one direction only
examples: direct current

definitions.text: being an immediate result or consequence
examples: a direct result of the accident

definitions.text: in precisely the same words used by a writer or speaker
examples: a direct quotation
repeated their dialog verbatim

definitions.text: lacking compromising or mitigating elements; exact
examples: the direct opposite

definitions.text: without deviation
examples: the path leads directly to the lake
went direct to the office
